Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Well, Seymour, I made it, despite your directions.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Ah, Superintendent Chalmers! Welcome. I hope you're prepared for an unforgettable luncheon!

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Oh egads! My roast is ruined!

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: But what if I were to purchase fast food and disguise it as my own cooking? Ho ho ho, delightfully devilish, Seymour.

Speaker: SINGERS
Line: ♪ Skinner with his crazy explanations, the superintendent's gonna need his medication. ♪

Speaker: SINGERS
Line: ♪ When he hears Skinner's lame exaggerations, there'll be trouble in town tonight! ♪

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: SEYMOUR!

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Superintendent, I was just stretching my calves on the windowsill. Isometric exercise. Care to join me?

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Why is there smoke coming out of your oven, Seymour?

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Uh... Ooh! That isn't smoke, it's steam! Steam from the steamed clams we're having. Mmm, steamed clams!

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: I thought we were having steamed clams.

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Oh no, I said steamed hams. That's what I call hamburgers.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: You call hamburgers "steamed hams"?

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Yes. It's a regional dialect.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Uh-huh. Uh, what region?

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Uh... upstate New York?

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Really? Well I'm from Utica and I've never heard anyone use the phrase "steamed hams."

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Oh, not in Utica, no. It's an Albany expression.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: I see...

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: You know, these hamburgers are quite similar to the ones they have at Krusty Burger.

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Oh ho ho no! Patented Skinner burgers. Old family recipe!

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: For steamed hams?

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Yes...

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Yes, and you call them steamed hams despite the fact they are obviously grilled.

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: You know — one thing I should... excuse me for one second.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Of course.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Well, that was wonderful. A good time was had by all. I'm pooped.

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Yes, I should be— Good Lord, what is happening in there?!

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Aurora Borealis?

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: Uh— Aurora Borealis?! At this time of year, at this time of day, in this part of the country, localized entirely within your kitchen?!

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Yes!

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: ...May I see it?

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: No.

Speaker: AGNES
Line: Seymour! The house is on fire!

Speaker: SKINNER
Line: No, Mother, it's just the Northern Lights.

Speaker: CHALMERS
Line: Well, Seymour, you are an odd fellow, but I must say — you steam a good ham.
